questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 3 teacups on his desk. If he adds 2 more, how many teacups does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 3 + 2 = 5. Professor Tinkles now has 5 teacups on his desk!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is counting his garden tools. He has 7 tools and gives away 3. How many tools does he have left?
questions.explanation: 7 - 3 = 4. Sir Whiskersworth has 4 garden tools remaining!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is organizing her books. She has 2 shelves with 4 books each. How many books does she have in total?
questions.explanation: 2 shelves Ã— 4 books = 8 books. Lady Pawsington has 8 books in her collection!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson found 12 clues in his investigation. If he divides them equally among 3 cases, how many clues per case?
questions.explanation: 12 Ã· 3 = 4. Each case gets 4 clues. Elementary, my dear student!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is counting by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8, ?. What comes next?
questions.explanation: Counting by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. The next number is 10!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 5 flower pots. He buys 3 more. How many flower pots does he have now?
questions.explanation: 5 + 3 = 8. Sir Whiskersworth now has 8 flower pots in his garden!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 9 algebra books. She lends 2 to a friend. How many books does she have left?
questions.explanation: 9 - 2 = 7. Lady Pawsington has 7 algebra books remaining!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson has 3 boxes with 5 clues each. How many clues does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 3 boxes Ã— 5 clues = 15 clues. Inspector Clawson has 15 clues in total!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 16 tea bags. If he uses 4 tea bags per day, how many days will they last?
questions.explanation: 16 Ã· 4 = 4. Professor Tinkles' tea bags will last 4 days!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is counting by 3s: 3, 6, 9, 12, ?. What comes next?
questions.explanation: Counting by 3s: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15. The next number is 15!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 4 pencils. She buys 6 more. How many pencils does she have now?
questions.explanation: 4 + 6 = 10. Lady Pawsington now has 10 pencils!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson has 11 pieces of evidence. He solves 4 cases. How many pieces of evidence are left?
questions.explanation: 11 - 4 = 7. Inspector Clawson has 7 pieces of evidence remaining!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 2 tea sets with 6 cups each. How many cups does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 2 tea sets Ã— 6 cups = 12 cups. Professor Tinkles has 12 cups in total!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 18 seeds. If he plants 6 seeds per row, how many rows can he make?
questions.explanation: 18 Ã· 6 = 3. Sir Whiskersworth can make 3 rows of seeds!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is counting by 5s: 5, 10, 15, 20, ?. What comes next?
questions.explanation: Counting by 5s: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25. The next number is 25!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 6 teacups and buys 3 more. How many teacups does he have now?
questions.explanation: 6 + 3 = 9. Professor Tinkles now has 9 teacups for his tea ceremony!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 12 garden tools and gives away 4. How many tools does he have left?
questions.explanation: 12 - 4 = 8. Sir Whiskersworth has 8 tools remaining in his garden shed!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 3 shelves with 6 books each. How many books does she have in total?
questions.explanation: 3 shelves Ã— 6 books = 18 books. Lady Pawsington's library is well-stocked!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson has 20 clues and wants to organize them into 4 equal groups. How many clues per group?
questions.explanation: 20 Ã· 4 = 5. Inspector Clawson has 5 clues in each organized group!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is counting by 3s: 3, 6, 9, 12, ?. What comes next?
questions.explanation: Counting by 3s: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15. The next number is 15!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth has 7 flower pots and buys 5 more. How many flower pots does he have now?
questions.explanation: 7 + 5 = 12. Sir Whiskersworth now has 12 flower pots in his garden!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has 15 algebra books and gives away 7. How many books does she have left?
questions.explanation: 15 - 7 = 8. Lady Pawsington has 8 algebra books remaining!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson has 4 cases and each case has 8 clues. How many clues does he have in total?
questions.explanation: 4 cases Ã— 8 clues = 32 clues. Inspector Clawson has quite a collection of evidence!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles has 24 tea bags and wants to use 6 per day. How many days will they last?
questions.explanation: 24 Ã· 6 = 4. Professor Tinkles' tea bags will last 4 days!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is counting by 4s: 4, 8, 12, 16, ?. What comes next?
questions.explanation: Counting by 4s: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20. The next number is 20!
